New Records: Mason Miller recorded his 23rd save in 25 chances, matching Huston Street’s mark in 2005 for second-most saves by a rookie Oakland reliever.
Key Match Events: Seth Brown hit two home runs, including a three-run homer in the eighth inning to lead the A's to a 9-6 win.
Will Benson hit a go-ahead three-run homer for the Reds in the seventh inning.
Lawrence Butler homered on the game’s third pitch for a 1-0 Oakland lead.
Brent Rooker added his team-leading 31st homer in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Seth Brown emphasized the importance of 'punching back' and maintaining a strong mindset.
A's manager Mark Kotsay praised the team's character and confidence in their comeback.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a pitchers' duel-turned-slugfest at Great American Ball Park.
Oakland starter Osvaldo Bido retired the first 13 batters he faced and allowed just one hit through six innings before running out of gas in the seventh.
